tables.description: Stores information about users in the system.

columns.name: Full name of the user.
columns.role: Role of the user in the system (e.g., admin, agent).
columns.created_at: Timestamp when the user account was created.

columns.user_id: ID of the user who reported the incident.
columns.priority: Priority level of the incident (e.g., low, medium, high).
columns.status: Current status of the incident (e.g., open, resolved).
columns.created_at: Timestamp when the incident was created.
columns.resolved_at: Timestamp when the incident was resolved.

tables.description: Records IT assets assigned to users.

columns.assigned_to: User ID the asset is assigned to.

columns.name: Name of the department.
columns.manager_id: User ID of the department manager.

columns.user_id: ID of the user who raised the ticket.
columns.subject: Brief description of the issue.

tables.description: Articles and documentation available to users.

columns.title: Title of the article.
columns.created_by: User ID of the article creator.
columns.created_at: Timestamp when the article was created.

tables.description: Tracks change requests within the IT infrastructure.

columns.request_id: Unique identifier for the change request.
columns.requested_by: User ID who requested the change.

columns.log_id: Unique identifier for each log entry.
columns.user_id: User involved in the logged activity.
